result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing Hearing 4/7/16
from court reporter

Defendant Nigel R Schultz in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Defendant Nigel R Schultz in custody.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to dismiss/read in entirely.  Court so orders.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 7, 2016 at 10:15 am.

Defendant Nigel R Schultz in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  DE in custody.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State states cases, parties state appearances and status.  Atty Middleton notes matters were set for a plea today but there some more things he needs to discuss w/the State.  Requests a short adjournment.  Court agrees to short adjournment.  Suggests Atty Middleton talk to his assistant after court today.  Atty Ryan notes Atty Middleton is not at fault as he just received some information this morning that he should have received earlier and that will not happen again.  Court orders bond continued in all matters.
Plea hearing on March 31, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Status hearing on April 11, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Melville Peter Middleton in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties recv'd evaluation.  Looking for a plea/sentencing date.  Reset for status conference 30 days out.  Status hearing scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
of Dr. Merrick $3975
William Merrick
Status hearing at 03-14-2016 01:00 pm
fax cover sheet
Call from Dr. Merrick.  Problems in completing eval.  Will have it to the Court by 2/25/16.
Dr. William Merrick

Defendant Nigel R Schultz in court with attorney Peter Middleton .  Defendant Nigel R Schultz in custody.  Mike Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court enters Not Guilty plea but not guilty by mental disease or defect.  Continue to track felonies together. Court order Order for NGI.
Rec'd copy of INFO/waived reading

Defendant Nigel R Schultz in court with attorney Peter MIddleton.  Defendant Nigel R Schultz in custody.  Mike Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 2.
Preliminary hearing at 12-18-2015 10:15 am

Defendant Nigel R Schultz appeared by video means with Attorney Middleton. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  State goes through criminal history.  State request $1500.00 cash bond.  Attorney Middleton has no objection.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits not waived. $1500.00 CASH bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 10:15 am.
